Aikhenvald considers evidential markers to be grammatical markers and argues that European languages do not possess such evidentials .She acknowledges that European languages do exhibit evidential strategies , consisting of lexical expressions of evidentiality .In contrast , the authors in this book consider lexical evidentials as true evidentials and argue that ' ' grammatical systems develop ' ' , and that ' ' grammaticalization implies by necessity that forms are not yet fully grammaticalized ' ' ( p. 4 ) .
